text: Psalm 26
A Prayer for Vindication
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 26 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity,
and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.
Prove me, O Yahweh, and test me.
Try my ⸤innermost being⸥\f + \fr 26:2 \ft Literally “kidneys,” the locus of intense thoughts and emotions in biblical Hebrew \f* and my ⸤mind⸥.\f + \fr 26:2 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
Because your loyal love \add is\add* before my eyes,
and I walk about in your faithfulness.
I do not sit with deceitful people,
nor will I go about with hypocrites.
I hate \add the\add* crowd of evildoers,
and with \add the\add* wicked I will not sit.
I will wash my hands in innocence,
and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,
to declare with a voice of thanksgiving,
and tell of all your wondrous deeds.
O Yahweh, I love \add the\add* dwelling of your house,\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Or “temple” \f*
and ⸤the place where your glory abides⸥.\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Literally “the place of the dwelling place of your glory” \f*
Do not destroy me\f + \fr 26:9 \ft Or “gather my soul \fq for judgment \ft ” \f* with \add the\add* sinners,
nor my life with men of bloodshed,
in whose hands \add is\add* an evil plan,
and whose right hand is full of bribes.\f + \fr 26:10 \ft Hebrew “bribe” \f*
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity.
Redeem me and be gracious to me.
My foot stands on level ground.
In assemblies I will bless Yahweh.
